chefs.name: Chef Ahmed
chefs.bio: Chef Ahmed is a renowned chef in Bangladesh. He has over 15 years of experience in the culinary industry and has worked in several popular restaurants in Dhaka.

recipes.name: Chicken Biriyani
recipes.cooking_method: Boil the rice and cook chicken with spices. Layer the rice and chicken in a pot and cook for 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Beef Curry
recipes.cooking_method: Cook beef with spices and add tomatoes and onions. Simmer until the beef is tender.

recipes.name: Lentil Soup
recipes.cooking_method: Boil lentils and add tomatoes and onions. Cook until the lentils are soft and tender.

chefs.name: Chef Farhana
chefs.bio: Chef Farhana is a self-taught chef who specializes in traditional Bangladeshi cuisine. She has been cooking for over 20 years and is known for her delicious curries and biriyanis.

recipes.name: Beef Biriyani
recipes.cooking_method: Boil the rice and cook beef with spices. Layer the rice and beef in a pot and cook for 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Fish Curry
recipes.cooking_method: Cook fish with spices and add tomatoes and onions. Simmer until the fish is tender.

recipes.name: Chickpea Curry
recipes.cooking_method: Boil chickpeas and add tomatoes and onions. Cook the tomato in soft heat. Simmer until the chicken-meat is tender.

chefs.name: Chef Khadija
chefs.bio: Chef Khadija is a master of Bangladeshi street food. She has been cooking for over 25 years and is famous for her mouth-watering snacks and desserts.

recipes.name: Pitha
recipes.cooking_method: Mix the ingredients and shape them into small pancakes. Fry them in ghee until golden brown.

recipes.name: Samosa
recipes.cooking_method: Make a dough with flour and water. Fill the samosas with spiced potatoes and peas. Fry until crispy.

recipes.name: Mishti Doi
recipes.cooking_method: Boil the milk and add sugar, cardamom, and saffron. Let it cool and mix with yogurt. Keep it in a warm place overnight.

chefs.name: Chef Nasir
chefs.bio: Chef Nasir is a culinary school graduate who specializes in fusion cuisine. He has worked in several Michelin-starred restaurants and is known for his innovative dishes.

recipes.name: Spicy Beef Tacos
recipes.cooking_method: Cook beef with spices and fill the tortillas. Top with lettuce, tomatoes, and salsa.

recipes.name: Shrimp Fried Rice
recipes.cooking_method: Cook rice and mix with stir-fried shrimp, eggs, carrots, and peas.

recipes.name: Vegetable Curry
recipes.cooking_method: Cook vegetables with spices and add tomatoes and onions. Simmer until the vegetables are tender.

chefs.name: Chef Rumi
chefs.bio: Chef Rumi is a home cook who has been sharing her traditional Bangladeshi recipes on social media for the past 5 years. She is passionate about preserving the country's culinary heritage.

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the fish in a paste of mustard, turmeric, and green chili. Fry the fish in hot oil until golden brown.

recipes.name: Aloo Posto
recipes.cooking_method: Boil potatoes and mash them. Mix with a paste of poppy seeds and green chili. Add mustard oil and salt.

recipes.name: Bhapa Pitha
recipes.cooking_method: Mix the ingredients and steam in a banana leaf for 20 minutes.

chefs.name: Chef Ayesha
chefs.bio: Chef Ayesha is a pastry chef who has worked in several high-end hotels in Bangladesh. She is famous for her cakes and desserts.

recipes.name: Black Forest Cake
recipes.cooking_method: Bake layers of chocolate cake and fill with whipped cream and cherries. Cover with more whipped cream and decorate with chocolate shavings.

recipes.name: Gulab Jamun
recipes.cooking_method: Make a dough with milk powder and flour. Shape into balls and fry in hot oil. Soak in sugar syrup and rose water.

recipes.name: Chocolate Truffles
recipes.cooking_method: Melt chocolate and mix with heated cream and butter. Add cocoa powder and vanilla extract. Shape into balls and finally freeze it deep before serving.
